reviewText: I just want to say thanks to Steve and all the guys in his awesome band for this dvd which is fantastic from top to bottom.  All the tunes you want are here and almost always exceed the originals. There is some great jamming going on here as all the players are great soloists and Steve is the generous boss who lets the fellas show off their chops. And the 'blues' segment in the middle is wonderful. The Jimmie Vaughan tune is a gem. A must own for sure. This is a no brainer.  Buy it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a 1st class concert.  The 5.1 surround sound is perfect and the video is clear.  Steve and the band are fabulous.  A must have.  Rates very high in my 100 DVD concerts.  The do some great covers and Steve's hits as well.  When it was over, I was wanting to shout More! More! More! as if I were there.Regarding the comments about the rapping guy on the 1st song - a) It is the keyboard player that does a 1-2 min. rap during the middle of the song, after some instrument solos and then the song resumes.  He does not do any more during the concert.  I'm not a rap fan either, but it really doesn't take away from an 8 minute version of the song.Also, don't even compare the Austin City Limits concert.  The sound is only in 2 channel stereo and is not very good at that.  Hardly surprising considering government involvement (i.e. PBS).  Don't waste your time nor money on the Austin City Limits DVD if you have a high quality 5.1 surround sound system and like to crank it up just like being at the concert like I do.
summary: A must have for anyone who likes 70s and 80s rock and roll

reviewText: This is a fantastic concert.  Excellent in every aspect: great song list, audio, visuals, performance, crowd response.I have been enjoying this concert for many years and wish it will soon get the Blu-ray treatment it deserves.I will buy it immediately.  Amazon please take note.

reviewText: A smallish out-door concert venue filmed with great audio and video mixing. No fancy pyrotechnics, laser lighting or other effects needed. They perform a nice selection of pop, jam, blues and even one country song for a total of 20 songs. If you have heard Steve Miller's stuff before and like his style, buy this.I haven't watched DVD #2 or listened to the CD yet.

reviewText: I was graduating from high school during the early years of the songs on the DVD were originally released. This brings back a lot of great memories. The music is still ahead of its time even with today's standards. High quality music that sounds better than ever.

reviewText: The show was great. Steve had really good players w/him.. With all the music he has recorded I don't know why he has to throw in copy tunes of other bands even if they were some of his fav. musicians. The only other thing about the dvd I didn't like was the price was a little high compared to other dvds. Sound was very good & the venue looked very nice. The cameras liked blonde women in the audience.. lol.

reviewText: THE STEVE MILLER BAND HAS ALWAYS BEEN A GREAT CONCERT SHOW.I'VE SEEN THE BAND 10 TIMES AND NEVER BEEN DISSAPOINTED. THIS CONCERT IS BY FAR THE BEST SHOW I'VE SEEN.THE CONCERT IS FILMED BETTER THAN ANY SHOW I OWN.THE BAND WAS SO TIGHT THAT THE CONCERT WAS OVER BEFORE I KNEW IT.THE MUSIC STANDS ALONE BUT THE EFFORT THAT WENT INTO THE PLAYING AND FILMING REALLY COMES THRU. AFTER SEEING THIS DVD WE BOUGHT TICKETS TO SEE THE SHOW IN AUGUST. THE SHOW WE ARE GONNA SEE HAS JOE COCKER OPENING FOR THEM. WHAT A COMBO...SWINGTOWN, HERE WE COME......

reviewText: If you ever liked Steve Miller, your really going to enjoy this. This is really a good video. The sound and video are excellent. The video takes up 2 DVD's. He plays not only about every hit he had, but throws in a few really great blues tunes.I have only one slightly negative comment. The first song is rather long and drawn out (kinda like my review). But overall, this is Steve Miller at his very best.
summary: Steve Miller Band Live From Chicago
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just picked this DVD up. I've been waiting for it to be released with baited breath, and I was not disappointed! The show doesn't have spectacular lighting or effects... it is just a group of guys playing straight forward blues-rock. The band seems to be enjoying themselves immensely. I was worried the songs might be straight from album renditions, but not to worry. The band does a fair amount of jamming, especially on Fly Like An eagle, coming in at about 15 minutes. There is a rap segment in the middle of the song that- well I'm getting used to it, but would have preferred it wasn't there. On both sides of the rap is some excellent guitar jamming. Another highlight was Winter Time. The stage lighting/effects are not played up because the band is so good, they don't need the distractions. This is a great DVD. The 2nd disk, while interesting, is disposable. I probably won't watch it more than the one time I already have. The CD is great (and fortunately includes Fly Like An Eagle). So for 18 bucks, between the DVD and CD, you definitely get your moneys worth. My wife could not have told you a song by Steve Miller, but having heard the DVD I find her putting it on while she does stuff around the house. Truly, that says it all!
summary: stripped down rock and roll at its best

reviewText: I've been a long time Steve Miller fan.  My wife and I used to see himrequently when we were first married, back probably 35 years now.I loved his music and his concerts then, and this one certainly kept up tohis early concerts.  He still gives his all to his music and his audience.The only thing that lacked was the light show!  Back in the late 60s heput on one heck of a light show. He was one of the first ones to use laserin his shows, bounced off of a crystal ball, now that made you feel likeyou were out in space! Kinda would have liked to have seen that.However I should be more grown up now I guess, and be more concerned aboutthe music, and I'd have to say it is the same as always, great, now if he'll just come to my area sometime when I can get a sitter!Rock on!

reviewText: Steve Miller has led a charmed life, with associations with a number of Rock & Roll Hall of Famers and Future Hall of Famers over his long and distinguished career. This DVD/CD package benefits from a deft production touch. The set list for the concert is very strong, including great songs and hits from Steve's lengthy career. Not only does the concert include the hits, but also some lesser known nuggets well known only to those who follow Steve closely "Mercury Blues" and an homage to Robert Johnson "Crossroads". This is a DVD that really should join the others in your collection, as it is a fine performance captured with outstanding video and audio quality.
summary: Tremendous Performance: Add this to your collection
Title: N/A

reviewText: Don't waste your money on this garbage! As much as I wanted to like this amazingly 1st Steve Miller DVD, it's a mediocre performance at best. I'm 58 & I've been enjoying Steve Miller for over 40 years. I'm sure the bulk of the good reviews are from much younger people. But this Baby-Boomer is very disappointed that I wasted $25 on this junk. Seeing an old man with long white hair playing harmonica along with a few other old geezers is disheartening. I'll admit that Steve Miller looks great for 63 but his playing & singing along with the band is lackluster. Forget this one!

reviewText: I bought this for my husband and learned I knew many of the songs, just didn't know the singer that well. Used to play Space Cowboy on a jukebox at a Chinese restaurant in the mid to late 70s. This production is just beautifully done--great video and audio and Norton Buffalo is still alive and with the band. It came with a cd and now I can hear my husband driving up the street with it blasting away. Maybe the best gift I have given him in a while!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Now Steve Miller fans can experience him live without hopping on a big old "Jet Airliner" to Chicago to do it. Filmed before an enthusiastic crowd at the Ravinia Amphitheater in Chicago the Steve Miller "Live from Chicago" concert DVD is guaranteed to please fans of all ages. It's a magical night in Chicago and the band is in fine form as they "Fly like an Eagle" through twenty of their greatest hits. From the moment the concert starts until the last song is played fans realize they're in for a magical night they won't soon forget.Filmed live in the summer of 2007 this concert DVD showcases the band like nothing I've ever seen or heard before. Its all hear in one fantastic show filmed with multiple cameras in high definition and the picture and sound definitely doesn't disappoint. The crisp playing by the entire band and great vocals from Steve Miller is proof of why fans still come to see him perform. He is such a class act that he even pauses to sign autographs for a couple fans before the last song is played. Hearing the band play Fly like an Eagle, Jungle Love and Jet Airliner was worth the price of this DVD set.Koch Entertainment has to be commended for their efforts in bringing Steve Miller fans this live concert performance. The video and audio transfers of this concert are truly spectacular. The picture filmed in HD is crisp and clear and the colors are sharp and vibrant to say the least. The sound is crisp and clean and the 5.1 Dolby Digital and DTS sound absolutely rock! This incredible 3 disc set containing the concert DVD, bonus features DVD and audio CD is a definite must have for any Steve Miller Fan. My only complaint is with the disc packaging, the concert and bonus discs sit on top of one another making it tricky to take them out. If you're careful it shouldn't be a problem. I hope this information was helpful.The Band:Steve Miller.........Lead Vocals, GuitarNorton Buffalo.......Harmonicas & VocalsGordy Knudtson.......DrumsKenny Lee Lewis......Guitars & VocalsBilly Peterson.......Bass & VocalsJoseph Wooten........Keyboards & VocalsDVD Features:Disc #1Fly Like an EagleLiving in the USATrue Fine LoveAbracadabraMercury BluesThe StakeShu Ba Da Du Ma Ma Ma MaBoom Bapa BoomAll Your LovinCrossroadsSerenadeDance, Dance, DanceWild Mountain HoneyWinter TimeRock' N MeTake the Money and RunThe JokerSwingtownJungle LoveJet AirlinerDisc #2-Documentary-Photo Gallery- Joel Selvin Radio Program (Steve Miller Interview in a Checker Cab)-DVD CreditsDisc #3 (Audio CD)Rock' N MeThe JokerThe StakeJungle LoveSerenadeTake the Money and RunJet AirlinerShu Ba Da Du Ma Ma Ma MaFly Like an EagleAbracadabraWinter TimeWild Mountain Honey

reviewText: I just saw the Steve Miller Band at the Indian Casino in San Bernardino, early June, 2008.  They played the same set on this DVD.  Miller is a master of the blues guitar; he has that "South Side of Chicago" sound down.  But he also mixes in long jams, including "Children of the Future" from '67 (I brought that blue/red album in high school) filled with psychedelia.  The light show, in concert, makes one feel like you're back at the Fillmore, back when you had hair, dancing the light fantastic on acid.  Steve Miller, in the tradition of the blues, talks between song sequences.  He showed and played us a guitar that the rock hall-of-fame offered him $820,000 -- which he brought for $150 from Max's in New York a long time ago.  He shared that this DVD/CD is number one on the charts.  What chart? (LOL).  At the end Miller plays his rock hits.  I'd prefer Miller to stick to the blues and rock, and forget the jams.  But some of those get interesting.  The only negative moment is the rap song, please!  The only thing missing on this DVD is the Bo Diddley tribute, "Pretty Thing", Miller did to honor the passing of the master.  Believe me, you'll love this DVD, and the Steve Miller Band, if you get a chance to see them live.  Oh, one more thing, the girls next to us hurled, and the police removed them from the hall (added entertainment).
Title: N/A
